conclusion: To determine whether the displacements of cars A and B are the same during the time interval from t = 0 to t = t1, we need to analyze the areas under their respective velocity-time curves in the provided graph.
The displacement of a car in a velocity-time graph is given by the area under the curve between the specified time interval.
For car A, the area represents a trapezoid-like shape under the curve.
For car B, the area represents a triangle-like shape under the curve.

premise: Car A’s velocity increases from v1 to v2 in the time interval t = 0 to t = t1.
conclusion: The area (displacement) for Car A can be approximated by finding the area of the trapezoid: Area A = 1/2 × (v1 + v2) × t1

premise: Car B’s velocity decreases from v2 to v1 in the same time interval.
conclusion: The area (displacement) for Car B can be approximated by finding the area of the triangle: Area B = 1/2 × (v2 - v1) × t1

premise: Compare the two areas calculated: Area A = 1/2 × (v1 + v2) × t1 and Area B = 1/2 × (v2 - v1) × t1
conclusion: These areas are not the same unless v1 = v2.
The areas, and thus the displacements, are different.
